biography:
Grammy nominated Kyle Dixon, along with musical partner Michael Stein, half of the Austin band S U R V I V E traveled back in musical time to soundtrack the biggest pop culture phenomenon of 2016: the Netflix series Stranger things. The duo's dreamy, throwback score helped sell the nostalgic ode to when Carpenter and Spielberg were the tastemakers of the horror/fantasy genre. Series creators The Duffer Brothers fell in love with the band's albums, which spin classic synths into a soundtrack of the year that garnered two Grammy nominations for Best Score Soundtrack for Visual Media.

Dixon, a Texas native was born in the early 1980s when the inspirations for Stranger things were being made. Dixon met Stein as teenagers, and both eventually gravitated towards the analog, electronic tones of their childhoods. S U R V I V E has quickly exploded from being a hip Austin act to touring the US and Europe.
name: Kyle Dixon

theaudiodb.biography_en:
Grammy nominated Kyle Dixon, along with musical partner Michael Stein, half of the Austin band S U R V I V E traveled back in musical time to soundtrack the biggest pop culture phenomenon of 2016: the Netflix series Stranger things. The duo's dreamy, throwback score helped sell the nostalgic ode to when Carpenter and Spielberg were the tastemakers of the horror/fantasy genre. Series creators The Duffer Brothers fell in love with the band's albums, which spin classic synths into a soundtrack of the year that garnered two Grammy nominations for Best Score Soundtrack for Visual Media.

Dixon, a Texas native was born in the early 1980s when the inspirations for Stranger things were being made. Dixon met Stein as teenagers, and both eventually gravitated towards the analog, electronic tones of their childhoods. S U R V I V E has quickly exploded from being a hip Austin act to touring the US and Europe.
theaudiodb.name: Kyle Dixon

lastfm.bio_content: Correctly tagged as Kyle Dixon & Michael Stein, they are members of the American synth band S U R V I V E and composers of the soundtrack to Netflix's hit series "Stranger Things". Just as its story goes deep referencing the classics of VHS era science fiction and horror movies, Dixon and Stein's music is hugely inspired by the likes of John Carpenter and Tangerine Dream, the masters of tension and synth soundscapes. While indebted to the classics, they've still managed to create instantly recognizable classic themes, making the series even more mysterious and memorable. Read more on Last.fm. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License; additional terms may apply.
